abstract: Many evangelical churches, colleges and ministries are engaging in unprecedented talks about homosexuality, as acceptance of same-sex marriage becomes more common nationwide; evangelical leaders are still opposed to homosexuality, but are attempting to avoid alienating growing numbers of Americans who support gay rights.
lead_paragraph: Encouraged by younger Christians and cultural shifts, some church leaders are having what they describe as unprecedented discussions about homosexuality.

headline.main: Evangelicals Open Door to Debate on Gay Rights
